channel.title: Fixmbr
channel.description:
Before I start this topic I would just like to say: WINDOWS 7 SUX (win Me standard)!
So about half a year ago I install win7 on my netbook(for retards- no dvd drive) and it looks like that it wrote the new bootloader to the MBR. After several diagnoses(of a problem on xp) I have decided I want to recover the netbook to factory settings using the recovery partition. Normally you press F9 and it boots the recovery partition however since the mbr automatically loads the vista/7 bootloader and not ntldr I cannot use the function.
This means I need to re-write the mbr, so I installed xp recovery console and run the fixmbr command. This has made no difference. How can I solve this?
note: when I run the fixmbr command it bitches about the mbr being not recognisable.

item.title: Fixmbr
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

the bank:

Try running fixboot first.

Wow I am stupid.
I really should have looked through the cmdcons command list. Thanks the bank.

Now all I need to do is change the boot flags and system recovery should work.

Read full topic

item.title: Fixmbr
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

Try running fixboot first.

Read full topic

So about half a year ago I install win7 on my netbook(for retards- no dvd drive) and it looks like that it wrote the new bootloader to the MBR.
